description: Seven men who took over a vulnerable person's home to run a drugs line have been jailed.
title: Sheffield: Cuckooing gang jailed after DNA found on toothbrushes
title_page: Sheffield: Cuckooing gang jailed after DNA found on toothbrushes - BBC News
maintext:
Seven men who took over a vulnerable person's home to run a drugs line have been jailed after a year-long investigation.
Mohammed Othmam, 29, Mohammed Ali, 36, and others in their teens and 20s used the victim's home for the illegal operation in a process known as "cuckooing".
Seven were jailed and three given suspended sentences at Sheffield Crown Court on Monday, after pleading guilty to conspiracy to supply Class A drugs in November.
Police found Â£2,500 worth of drugs at the Sheffield city centre flat and personal belongings, including multiple toothbrushes in the bathroom with DNA matching that of the gang members.
